Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Sound - Port Selection was interesting
Reviews.Author: B. Hoak
Reviews.Content: This is a new model (out March 2009), and is the just released 'B' version of the popular, judging by the many reviews, samsung 'A' version 32 inch TV. I wanted a TV with an excellent value for a 32 inch TV with a good 720p picture and sound.  The picture is actually fantastic and looks good on the standard setting and really stunning at the dynamic setting (if the room is light enough), and in the store looked slightly better then Sony Bravia S-Series KDL-32S5100 32-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV, Black even though that TV is a 1080p one. I did a visual comparison of the two for a while in the store becuase I was trying to justify going 1080p but couldnt since this picture seemed better even at 720p. If I could, I would have gone for the Sony BRAVIA XBR KDL-32XBR9 32-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV which looked the best though for a 32 inch overall.720p vs 1080p:I couldn't understand why a 1080p TV would make a difference with this size of TV, since I sit about nine feet away and at that distance I don't think you could tell - at least the PC input is small enough and sharp enough that I can read web pages comfortably from my couch but if it were any smaller it would be too small/detailed. I dont think I would use more than 720p detail unless I wanted to see more web page content on the screen and planned to sit about 4 feet away. The TV has exactly the same resolution asToshiba Satellite U305-S2804 13.3-inch Laptop (Intel Core 2 Duo T5450 Processor, 2 GB RAM, 160 GB Hard Drive, Vista Premium) which is what I plugged into the PC input and looks identical to that screen. Also, most Hi Def inputs to my TV aren't more than 720p anyway. I think one over the air station is 1080i.Standard DEF Input Handling:For 480i or standard def inputs at a non wide screen resolution, such as those from my cable box, it handles it extremely well. However, I have a digital cable box (verizon QIP6416-2) with an HMDI, component, svideo, and RCA even though the signal I get is only standard def. I didn't want to use up an HDMI port on the TV so I tried connecting the component but the color didn't work. This is an issue with the cable box, not the TV. I had to use the HDMI in the end since there was no s-video (a small negative for this TV) and didnt want to use the RCA. On the plus side, this TV has a great setting called wide fit/move that slightly streaches and zooms a 4/3 picture to fit the 16/9 widescreen. The move comes into play if you have channel that has scrolling text that becomes cut off at the bottom, so you can nudge the picture up a bit (which chops off the top more but you need to make a comprimose somewhere).Shines with HD inputs:When I hooked the component connections up to an HD upscaling DVD player Samsung DVD-HD860 Up-Converting DVD Playerthough that worked perfectly with the component connection.  My beloved Roku Roku Digital Video Player box is using the 2nd HDMI connector which looks great, and the over the air antenna CLEARSTREAM2 Antenna brings in over the air free HD on about 20 HD channels. All the HD sources (laptop, antenna, roku, upscaling DVD) really shine. Sound is good and I don't feel I need to get add on home theater sound since I dont turn the TV up loud.  I guess an extra HDMI connection would have been nice, especially since there was no S-video, but I still give the TV 5 stars as it is a new model and is thus forward looking.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST LCD ON THE MARKET FOR ITS  PRICE, PERIOD...
Reviews.Author: James Wright
Reviews.Content: I badly needed a new television, and decided on a whim to head to best buy and see what was available.  I hadn't been shopping for tv's in around 7 years, and from what I remembered that was when plasmas were amazing but all cost upwards of $4,000, and LCD, as a technology, just wasn't there yet.  To my amazement the TV's in the store, even those well under $1,000, all looked fantastic.  I settled on this tv after comparing it, endlessly, to other 32-inch models by Sony, Toshiba and LG.  The Samsung had the best clarity, image depth and color.  For only $550, this TV is gorgeous...standard cable looks good, DVD looks fantastic, and HD is just amazing.  After initially thinking I wanted a 1080p HD, not 720p, I realized that in this size it just doesn't matter, and isn't worth the extra money.  In all honesty, I felt like the 1080p image in this size television is a bit too sharp, a bit too bright and a bit too clear...it almost makes everything look like a cartoon or a video game.  In the end, you really can't beat this television...the internal speakers sound great, it looks damn sexy in any room, and the picture quality makes you wonder why you paid so little...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy! Excellent Brand! Excellent Quality!
Reviews.Author: A. StJohn
Reviews.Content: Much like many of the other customers who purchased the Samsung 32" B Series LCD television, I too, did MUCH research before buying this television. After going to Target, Walmart, BestBuy, and various online stores, I decided to purchase the Samsung after MANY comparisons, and for only $499.99 at BestBuy.Between the price, brand name, and overall quality we can expect from Samsung, it just made sense to buy this television set over Sony. This television was bought with the intention of not spending more than $500 and having it perform at least above average for my bedroom.Upon looking at comparable televisions, the Samsung had an AMAZING picture. It was EXCEPTIONALLY clear and very clean, new, and expensive looking. The options were exactly what I wanted: Computer input, 2 HDMI cable inputs, and multiple component inputs. It was 720P but after speaking with many owners and doing more and more research, it just isn't worth the money to purchase a 1080p TV set ($700+) when you WON'T be able to tell ANY real difference under 40" television sets - THAT IS A GUARANTEED FACT!Hope that helped....

Reviews.Title: Stunning....
Reviews.Author: Floyd Goodrich "Jim G."
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for three days now and could not be more pleased. The picture is crystal clear, the colors are deep and the contrast is great. Good sound and easily set up, didn't have to consult the owners manual once. The remote is laid out well and everything is easy to access. The only minor thing I don't care for is how you access the sleep mode timer. Unlike most remotes with a dedicated button for the sleep timer on it, you have to open a menu and drill down to set the sleep timer. As this is a great bedroom size, this could be a slight annoyance for those who use the sleep timer function a lot. That is the only con I have on this beautiful TV. This TV has a lot of high end features such as being able to name the various inputs, such as calling HDMI 1 as Satellite, HDMI 2, as DVD etc. I'm very happy with mine and for the money, its fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality, Sound, And Most Importantly...Price!
Reviews.Author: A. Hall "hustle"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Samsung LN32B360 720p LCD HDTV!!!!I knew I would like this t.v. the moment I took it out of the box. Although I was somewhat disappointed with this flat panel t.v having only 2 HDMI ports, I quickly got over it once turned it on. The picture quality this t.v. is amazing and the sound coming from it's speakers definitely impressed me to say the least. The t.v screen looks good from almost any angle. I'm happy with my purchase and I would definitely recommend this t.v to any who's in the market for buying a new lcd hdtv under 40" and won't put a huge whole in their wallet. I think 720p is sufficient for flat panel televisions under 40 inches. I think getting a 1080p flat panel t.v. under 40" would be a waste of many if you're buying it for the sole purpose of watching 1080p (1920x1080) resolution.I want to share my calibrated picture settings for this model t.v. with anyone who's looking to optimize their viewing pleasure. I'm content with these settings and I hope you find theses settings satisfying as well. Give Me Feedback on these settings. Tell me what you think or share your own picture settings.Picture Settings For Samsung LN32B360--Picture Menu'Mode: Movie'Backlight: 6'Contrast: 85'Brightness: 44'Sharpness: 9'Color: 57'Tint: G50/R50''Advanced Settings Submenu'Black tone: Off 'Dynamic contrast: Off'Gamma: 0'Color space: Auto'Flesh tone: 0'Edge enhancement: Off''White balance Submenu (Inside Picture Menu)'R-Offset: 25'G-Offset: 25'B-Offset: 25'R-Gain: 25'G-Gain: 25'B-Gain: 25''Picture Options Submenu (Inside Picture Menu)'Color tone: Warm2'Size: Screen Fit'Digital NR: Off'HDMI black level: Low'Film mode: Auto''--Setup Menu'Game Mode: Off'Energy saving: Off

Reviews.Title: Returned mine to Walmart...
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Linch Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Walmart about three weeks ago... and returned it three days later.I typically do lots of research before buying anything in this price range but, trusting the Samsung quality and ignoring the little voice in my head telling me not to "impulse shop", I went ahead and bought it anyway.  Couple issues I noted right away:1. The speakers would "pop", but randomly.  It might go one minute with hardly a pop, then you would hear six or seven in a matter of seconds, but it was subtle... often getting drown out by the volume itself.  But, once you noticed it for the first time, it was hard to ignore.  Im guessing these were the result of defective speaker(s).2. Being in the least used room, I had this TV hooked up to our lone standard definition cable (satellite) box.  While having read about blurred images in fast moving scenes on LCD's, I thought modern technology had pretty much eliminated this old shortcoming.  I was wrong.  I wasnt watching sports either, I was watching the 10 o'clock news.  It seemed whenever the news anchor turned their head, their head would stop just a split second before the image seemed to fully catch up.  My other two hi-def TV's are plasma and rear-projection LCD (modern tech only 5 years ago but now hard to find) and I had never noticed that shortcoming on either of them (but nor was their technology known to suffer from this).What else?  Even had the speakers not "popped", I thought the sound quality was poor.  It doesnt help that the speakers are built into the bottom frame facing down... meaning they are firing into the TV stand instead of out towards your ears.  Why some manufacturers are doing this is beyond me.  Again, being in our least used room, this TV was going to be stand alone... not hooked up to a receiver and alternate speakers.  Lastly, as others have stated about "piano black" finishes, its looks nice but attracts finger prints, hair, dust, etc.I know Samsung typically makes a quality HDTV product, but I think trying to appeal to the lower end of the price spectrum will cause companies to perhaps take shortcuts that they wouldnt make on their higher end sets.  That being said, of all the other 32 inch HDTV I viewed at Walmart, I thought this one had the best picture... in the store anyway.  :)

Reviews.Title: Very good set for the $!
Reviews.Author: J. Wray
Reviews.Content: I bought this Sammy to replace a wall mounted box TV in a bedroom. What a drastic improvement it made! Due to the compact size of the flat screen, it replaced a 21" box. The price was comparable to a Vizio at my local Walmart. I'll take a Sammy over a Vizio anytime. It came as specified in just a few days, mounted to the Cheetah wall mount I purchased here on Amazon, and I was enjoying the set in no time. I only rated it 4 stars due to the pic being 720, which for a 32" is good for a bedroom or den IMO. I think it would come up a little short for a home theater unit (what are you expecting for around $450!). All in all, It's a good set with enough features to satisfy the needs of most at a good price. Thanks Amazon for offering the Sammy at a Vizio price!

Reviews.Title: Was unsure.............
Reviews.Author: Camstache
Reviews.Content: After my good old "regular tube" tv just stopped working last week, I started looking into a new replacement television--boy was I confused! A lot has happened in electronics in the past 10 years! As someone who is not a high tech expert, I just wanted a tv that was inexpensive, , easy to use, and not loaded with stuff I would never use.I started talking with salespeople at BestBuy, Walmart, and Sears, and they all told me to go with a Samsung or a Sony. After reading reviews on this site and others, I decided to narrow my search to the Samsung models as the Sony 32" models seems to have a lot of problems with "boards" within the first year----so, a Samsung it would be.I found the 32" model on sale in several places, all around the $450 mark.(my limit was $500) Went to BestBuy where they price match, and got an open box model for even less---$399! Score!The tv was easy to set up (even for me! I really am NOT an electronics kind of guy) and within minutes I had an amazing picture off this set! I do NOT have cable, and am using only a digital antenna to get the signal, and still the picture is incredible! The pre-set settings for color, sound and such are just fine for me, and even though the sound comes out the bottom of the set, it sounds just fine to me. (other people reviewed that the sound was tinny and weak) I have only had the tv for 3 days now, so I am still getting used to this large , clear, defined picture, but so far so good! (you really DO see things much clearer, especially peoples faces) I would definitely recommend this television to people who arent totally into the whole "I need the top of the line television with all the bells and whistles".Depending on where you are, you should be able to pick this up for around $450-$475.Hope I am just as happy 2 years from now!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: B. A. Davis "obscure indie reference"
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD tv, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I am a student, and I needed something at the entry level price range, but I wanted something that I could feel confident purchasing. The picture quality is gorgeous, and the sound is pretty good too. I do not use the tv speakers as I run the sound through a receiver, but without one the sound is just fine. If you plan to watch Air signal programming, be sure to buy the antenna as well since you will need it to complement the tv's built-in tuner. Overall, I am a happy couch camper with this gorgeous LCD.

Reviews.Title: decent bargain lcd
Reviews.Author: CDF
Reviews.Content: If you're in need of a quality, bargain LCD, this model is pretty good.  After researching this and the Vizio brand, I went first hand to the nearest store carrying both.  It seemed the Samsung was brighter and more clearer in all of it's model's.  I don't subscribe to my cable provider's HD programming, but it was a major upgrade to my clunky 22" CRT.  It was also evident in the weight department, having to strain moving around the smaller 22" CRT (couldn't even fit the box it came in into my car) while I carried the LCD like a suitcase.  Basic inputs, sturdy stand, and overall good picture quality are available with this model.  If you don't want to break the bank, looking for an extra tv, or simply want to upgrade to better technology, you can't go wrong with this Samsung model.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV For Price
Reviews.Author: L. E. Markley
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for a TV within the price range that I wanted.  I was going to settle for a Vizio, thinking that was all I could get for my budget.  I found this Samsung, the NEW model, and was very pleased with the price and the reviews.  The TV came and I am very happy with it.  I didn't think I would be able to get as nice of a TV from a great brand for around $500.  My only complaint is that there are not enough of the type of video/audio inputs that I need for the type of components I have, but I was able to work around it.  The sound is awesome, and the features to be able to change and adjust brightness and colors are just great. The picture is clear and crisp, even without HD.  This is a perfect sized TV for a master bedroom.  I am thinking of getting a 50"+ Samsung for my livingroom.  Even my mom is jealous!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 720
Reviews.Author: Book reader "Mio Dio, mio tutto"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 10 days ago. They had this next to a Samsung 1080P and a Sony 720P and I could not see ANY difference except the price.

Reviews.Title: My first ever HD flat screen
Reviews.Author: Tequila20 "tequila20"
Reviews.Content: This 32"Samsung flat screen TV was our Christmas gift for myself and my husband,our first HD ever! It has been wonderful ,the picture was outstanding even before our HD hook up! We have bought a second one 42" for our frontroom with the same results. I am sold on Samsung.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Hernandez
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv 11 days ago at Target for $499. It just went on sale for $399. I brought my receipt in and Target gave me back the difference.  Compared to the other sets at the store, this one definitely had the best picture quality. The whites were white. On the other sets the whites looked dull.  I had a Proscan and returned it.  Then I tried a Sylvania and returned it.  I tried a Vizio...returned it.  Brought the Samsung home and I love it. I will not be returning it.  The picture and sound quality are amazing even up close.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazingly priced and looks great.  I use it in my bedroom and have it mounted on the wall about 7-8 feet away from head at viewing angle.  The 30,000 to 1 contrast ration is nice, and I was going to settle for a 26 inch but I'm glad I got the larger 32 inch, and at this price it was comparable to other 26 inch TV's I have seen.  THe remote is very simple and works well.  My only gripe and there may be a settig to change it, is when you click the source button, it brings up a menu of available sources and you have to click source again to change it, and then click select to close the display screen. Otherwise with all the right input options on the back,2 hdmi/1component/1 composite video this is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: One year wonder
Reviews.Author: Ryngwrayth
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV in March 2010 and it died today...a bit over a year later. Called tech and they were nice but couldn't do anything aside from tell me it needs service, and btw it's out of warranty.I wouldn't bother with this TV. It was a second TV not used but a couple hours daily over that time, and it now will not even turn on. We have a little red light that shows it's getting power...and that's it! Meanwhile the front room Toshiba...is going fine at 4-5 years old!Not pleased. Not at all.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32B360 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: T. Pruett "T-Pru"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'm very happy with the TV.  I did a lot of research on 32" LCD TV's and the Samsung had the best picture by far.  My only complaint is the quality of sound out of the built-in speakers. In retrospect I should have done more comparison research on the sound as it wasn't as good as the reviews had indicated.  Other than that, I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Only one night in, but i've put it through the paces.
Reviews.Author: Logan Ogden "Nagol"
Reviews.Content: I believe this is just about the best LCD you're going to find for the sub $500 price tag anywhere right now. I actually picked this up last night at a local electronics store that was selling it for $399! I was waiting for the "Black Friday" deals to come around, but I thought this was smarter as facing those massive crowds of consumer hungry individuals wasn't on my list of things I would like to do.Anyway, the Samsung has done nothing but impress me for the price. The first thing I did was hook up my PS3 and 360 in order to check that all was up to par. There is very minimal blur (to be expected from a 60hz LCD) but nothing too distracting as long as the viewer is at least 3-4 feet from the screen. I sit 7 so I barely noticed it. I am used to a 42" plasma that has no blur at all, so it took a little adjusting, but nothing major. Next I streaming Netflix. The SD movies were acceptable and the HD looked amazing. I would say it passed the test for that as well. I moved on to streaming HD content from my laptop through the xbox. This, again, looked more than acceptable. All I had left was BluRay... and let's just say that this was the cream of the crop when it came to the tests short of playing a game on the tv. The picture was crisp, bright, colorful and accurate. The blacks were great and the whites were blinding if chosen so.Overall, I am extremely satisfied with this purchase. This is the first Samsung I've ever purchased as I've stuck to plasmas in the past (mostly Panasonic) but I knew they didn't really compete as strongly in the LCD market. If I had to choose again I wouldn't change my choice... especially for the price tag that was associated.

Reviews.Title: Outshines LG and SONY
Reviews.Author: Serious Toolster Artifacer "Artifacer"
Reviews.Content: We looked and looked. Finally standing for almost an hour looking at the LG and SONY 32" 720's side by side. Can honestly say after looking at the 1080's that in this size the 720 outshines the 1080. If you are looking at a 50" set then it's a different story. Color was fantastic and superior to the LG in my opinion. Ease of set up is great. Design and layout of the remote is intuitive, making tweaking to get your final settings of the flesh tones, contrast, and sharpness  easily to your exact likings. Remote has some buttons allowing you direct adjustment of certain settings without going into the full menus to reset them. For a bedroom view of 8' to 10' the 32" is just great. I've had this TV for just about one week and have been trying to decide if I really need to upgrade to HD but guess I'll go all the way for the full experience. This TV really blows away your viewing experience. We purchased the 4 year extended warranty so reading the few negative reviews doesn't bother me! There will always be those Monday morning fabrications that will throw a clunker into the works. But I am pleased to the maximum from this purchase and highly recommend the Samsung LN32B360 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Powerless when power button malfunctions
Reviews.Author: LIstening Ear
Reviews.Content: Our LN32B360 last almost exactly 2 years with minimal use, when power button ceased working.  After web research, it seems that many owners have experienced the same failure (see CNET reviews). The repairs will involve work on the power board--most often replacing bad capacitors, costing from $150 to $300.I gave this product one star since there is no option for "zero" stars.NoSamSinging

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Great Second TV
Reviews.Author: Joshua Still
Reviews.Content: After lots of careful research, I decided to go with this Samsung TV based on customer reviews and professional reviews.  I am very glad to say that I am completely satisfied with this purchase.  The picture is great and the inputs in the back are sufficient to satisfy the needs of a bedroom/office TV.  Xbox 360, PC, Standard Def Cable, HDMI, all of the inputs necessary are available here.  Granted, there is only really one, maybe two of each type of input, but likely you are not buying a 32in TV to be your media center in your living room.  If you are, I would suggest either looking at a larger size or possibly the SONY - KDL series TV's.Either way, this is the bottom line: if you are in the market for the best bang-for-your-buck second TV, this is your best bet.  Sony and Panasonic have some good TV's at this size and near this price range, but in my opinion, this TV has the best picture of the three. Another thing: do not worry about this set being 720p. 720p is plenty at this screen size, so save yourself some money and stick with a 720p/1080i TV. The only reason I could find to go with a 1080p 32in TV would be if you intend to use it as a computer monitor, but even that might be overkill for some people. In addition, you may want to check out the calibration settings for this TV on CNET.com.  I used these setting and it makes the picture even richer.My final note: if you are thinking about buying a 32in TV, stop right now and buy this one.  You will enjoy it. I bought this from amazon.com and they delivered the TV the very next day!  I can't promise that you will have your TV delivered as quickly, but amazon gets an A++ from me in the customer service department!

Reviews.Title: Overall a solid TV, but with one issue...
Reviews.Author: M. Ram
Reviews.Content: I was going to write a long review of this TV, but I think a few points speak for themselves:-The stand was easy to assemble, and the TV is so light (yet durable) that it was a snap to install by myself. It rotates easily and smoothly, and diffuses light off the screen (so you don't have to watch movies in total darkness for fear of glare on the screen).-From the first time starting up, the TV prompts you to pick out a few settings of your choosing. We have (limited basic) cable, so I went into the menus afterward and had the TV scan through all the available channels. Amazingly, this TV picks up more channels (including a bunch of digital channels) than another HDTV (a 4-year-old plasma) that we have in a separate room. The broadcast channels are fuzzy of course, but the HD channels look fantastic! Of course, I had to modify the picture and audio settings to really make things look and sound good, but once they were set, I knew this TV was worth it. It only took around a half hour of tinkering and I think I'm done for good (as opposed to the plasma, which still has issues). The settings are also independent for each source, so you can watch movies and play games knowing they look their best. As for sound, the speakers are decent, especially with the SRS turned on, but the bass output is limited, and even a 2.1 surround setup will sound much richer.-I have an HD DVD player hooked up via one of the HDMI ports, and have sampled a few discs in high-definition, but what really surprises me is how good regular DVDs look. True, they're "upconverted" by the player, but it's still a wonder how they can look so good. The latest one I watched was the Pixar movie Up, and it looked PERFECT...it was crystal clear, with vivid colors and a real sense of depth and scale. The Blu-Ray version may have a higher resolution, but I was more than happy with what I saw (and this is coming from someone who just bought a PS3).-EDIT: The only nagging issue I have with the TV is with "ghosting," especially in dark scenes. This mainly seems to happen with HD channels and certain HD movies. For instance, I watched the HD DVD of Blade Runner, and at certain times (mainly during the chases through the dark city streets), there was a faint "trail" as the characters would turn their heads or run across the screen. I'm hoping this won't affect gaming on the PS3, but it is something to consider.-EDIT NEWS: The PS3 games and Blu-Rays look amazing and trouble-free. The ghosting only happens with certain (usually older) movies...I noticed it in Goodfellas and The Insider too. It's not a big deal, and only happens in dark scenes.-ADDITIONAL: Two other little things that bother me after having the TV for a month: When you turn it on, the red light goes dark and eventually comes back on, where I thought it should simply turn green. Also, the buttons on the remote don't glow in the dark, which would have been useful.

Reviews.Title: Everything has already been said about this...
Reviews.Author: Yllabian Space Guppy
Reviews.Content: ...  except whenever possible, connect the set via an HDMI cable (even if you only have regular cable) as the picture improved dramatically.  I initially used coax but wasn't at all pleased with the picture quality.  Next I tried the component connections as I had a spare set of new cables handy and while the picture improved, it still wasn't all that great.  I took CNET's advice and bought an El Cheapo HDMI cable from Ebay ($4.15 shipped!) and then the set then came to life.  The picture quality is very nice now.  BTW: don't spend any more than $5 shipped for an HDMI cable, you're wasting your money (look on Amazon and Ebay -- they are a ton of them out there).We've had the set for a couple of weeks now and are enjoying the free space in the family room that the old 26" CRT set and the old TV stand that it used to sit on occupied (the Samsung is mounted on the wall).  I see that Amazon has the set listed now at $399 with free shipping but when we got ours on Black Friday weekend, Best Buy had the best price I could find at $377.  My only gripe so far with buying from Amazon is that it takes them several days to get the order out the door.UPDATE: 02/24/10 - We've had this set for a couple of months now and it has been working great.  My only complaint so far is fairly trivial:  the remote control seems to have a very narrow window in which the set will detect the commands from the remote.  I am not sure if it's the TV or the remote itself that is the problem, but unless you are pointing the remote at a certain spot on the TV, it doesn't acknowledge the command(s).

Reviews.Title: After doing a lot of research, I settled on this Samsung and absolutely love it.
Reviews.Author: J. Pilares "BiG JeEzY"
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research, comparing and contemplating all the various choices I had when it came to LCD TVs of this size and price range, I decided this Samsung was the one for me. I took it home, removed it out of the box, assembled it, turned it on and as I had expected, was really impressed by what this TV had to offer.The picture quality is absolutely amazing. Especially when watching any blu ray movie. It just looks so crisp, colorful and the image moves so smoothly. The picture on this 720p TV looks just as brilliant as a 1080p TV of the same 32 inch size. I have a Playstation 3 connected to the TV using a Mediabridge Ultra Series HDMI cable and am still astonished today by how all my videogames have never looked, felt, and sounded so good before. This TV definitely is excellent for playing videogames, especially with its exclusive "Game Mode" which makes the games move even more smoother and more life-like. Picture settings and sound settings are both fully customizable as well as feature preset settings. The TV has simple, easy to follow menu screens that only took me a few moments to navigate through and learn. The remote is also simple and easy to use.I only have two complaints about this TV and they are relatively minor. Firstly, while the sound from the speakers is plenty loud and life-like, I would have wanted the speakers to have a little more bass to them. At a few instances when watching regular TV programming, it sounds clear but at the same time does sound kinda flat. However, they sound great when playing movies and games through my Playstation 3. Lastly, the picture loses some of its color when viewing the TV from the side. The TV is in one corner of my room and I have it facing diagonally towards the center of my room. Meaning, I view it from the side on occasion. When I do, the color fades out a bit. I heard this is very typical of LCDs and do see the exact same thing with other brands as well.Some people will opt for the other, more expensive, 32 inch LN32B460 model also made by Samsung because that model has 3 HDMI outputs compared to 2 HDMI outputs on this TV. However personally, I only need 2 HDMI outputs, one being for my Playstation 3, the other for the cable box. So a third HDMI output was really unnecessary for me. Plus, I love the glossy all-black finish of this TV. The other model has a different finish.Overall, I give this TV a 9.8/10, which is the highest rating I've given compared to any other 32 inch LCD. I'm extremely happy and look forward to years and years of use from it and will purchase another Samsung TV in the future. You can't go wrong with Samsung TVs, they are quality TVs in every sense of the word.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: W. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I picked this up around Black Friday '09 for just under $400.  I had tried to purchase an LCD TV a few years ago, before finally deciding on a plasma because I couldn't stand the motion blur of the LCDs.  I bought this TV as a gift for someone, and stopped by to check out the picture quality.  It was very good.  I checked a few different places -- sports stations, sometimes even the news ticker -- to see if I could notice any motion blur, and I saw none.  I wouldn't say the picture is better than plasma, but I was very impressed for it being an LCD.  I would definitely recommend this product.  I don't usually write reviews, but I wanted to write this one in case anyone had any of the same issues I had before buying it.  It is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: For the price, great TV
Reviews.Author: Rick Bogaard "rbinchicago"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great TV.  The sound isn't the best, about the only complaint I have.

Reviews.Title: bedroom wall unit
Reviews.Author: Gavin Gordon
Reviews.Content: samsung lg and sony all good systems great picture no issues. a steal at $400 3 yrs ago. with additional handy ports love it

Reviews.Title: TV used daily at home
Reviews.Author: Peter Attardo
Reviews.Content: Love all my Samsung products so far. TV works like new and its been 2 years now. love all my Samsung products. want to take my tablet to the afterlife.

Reviews.Title: samsung 32 inch TV
Reviews.Author: Brenda Hull
Reviews.Content: the TV has worked fine.  I will be looking at Samsung for my next purchase.  However, I hope that my future TV can be set for 15 minute sleep timer.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32B360 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: E. J. Krouze
Reviews.Content: This unit operates just fine, with the exception that it is placed in a spare bedroon that is not used very much. Otherwise it does meet its functions.  Should have bought a 1080p.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Jazz
Reviews.Content: I have this TV in my bedroomand it is perfect size,  good picture and much better than any others I have had over the years.

Reviews.Title: Best Purchase of last year
Reviews.Author: H. Pecor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV last year and I must say that this was the BEST purchase that I have ever made. The picture is wonderful, and the sound is decent for built in speakers (I always recommend purchasing external speakers). I bought this along with my PS3 and it was definitely worth the money. I have moved three dorms, two houses, and two apartments since purchasing this last year and it has never gotten damaged. I currently use it for my gaming computer monitor and it goes far beyond my expectations.  Samsung has never steered me wrong, and did not do so this time either.The size is great if you're in a small room(bedroom, small living room) and this is the PERFECT TV for a college student.I would purchase more of these. In fact, I'm in the market to buy another samsung like this one .. just ten inches bigger for my new living room.

Reviews.Title: Good valued TV
Reviews.Author: L. Vu
Reviews.Content: I just watched the Super Bowl on this TV last night. HD is excellent w/ vivid imaging and decent sound. Non-HD is okay. DVDs also look great when being hooked up via HDMI cable to an upconverting DVD player (Philips DVP5990 DVD Player with 1080p HDMI Upconversion & DivX highly recommended.) At this price, I guess it would be a good-valued TV. Should I recommend this TV to other folks? Yes, definitely.

Reviews.Title: Another Quality Set from Samsung
Reviews.Author: LipSmacker
Reviews.Content: This is my third Samsung LCD tv; seven overall for my entire family.  Samsung's tv's all perform well, and this model is no exception.  The 32" is the perfect size for a small bedroom or office.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: A. D'Angelo
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Best Buy for $399.  Color (I boosted to 70%) and Clarity is great for the price.  I have only had the product for 2 weeks and I have no issues so far.  I own a 37" Samsung (720p LCD), which is 2.5 years old and I have had no problem with that one as well.

Reviews.Title: Freaking Awesome Picture
Reviews.Author: Xanthus N. Murdaugh "The Phenom"
Reviews.Content: I'll make this short and sweet.  This TV produces deep black levels, and amazing bright colors.  Its energy efficient. My only squabble is it only has 2 HDMI ports and no side ports.  Bottom line, for entry level LCD 32" TVs, this set "takes the picture quality cake".

Reviews.Title: Great value for just enough features in an HD LCD TV...
Reviews.Author: DYI devotee
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV has all the features I need, a great picture, and was an excellent value all around. It also has an easy to use menu system and a clean design.There are always new TVs with more inputs and higher refresh rates Etc., but until the innovative HDMI 1.4 features (Ethernet, 3D, Audio return channel, 1440p) are available, I find a price point like this to be a great bargain for a fine TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Laura H. Essman
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery, easy to hook up, and a great picture.  We are so pleased with our new tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Sandy Beaches
Reviews.Content: Nov. 2009 .I received my TV in a timely manner, had it placed, plugged it in, and there was a beautiful picture. I am enjoying this television and know you will also be happy with the same model. Love the swivel base, which makes viewing easier from any angle. Samsung LN32B360 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV.May 30, 2011.  As an update to this review, the video on this set is not working and I have to take it to a TV repairman. For such a new TV, I am very disappointed that it has gone bad.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Greg "smitz0327"
Reviews.Content: Been trying the TV for about 2 weeks now and love the picture. The hi def is very good also. I use it in my bedroom for my computer monitor also and it looks great on that. One thing I do not like is the pain you have to go through to switch back and forth from PC to TV. When the TV is off and you turn it on to go to PC, if your not fast enough, it shuts down. Kind of a pain

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cameron J
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, pulled the trigger on the tv when it dropped to $378 on Black Friday. I used to have the Samsung LN32A450 but had to sell it when I moved. At the new place, I was actually content with the regular non-high definition tv, but when the price drops that much, I have to purchase it, mainly because Samsung TVs = qualityComparing the A450 to the B360... well I don't really notice any differences really. It has one less HDMI port but other than that it is all the same to me. I use mines for playing PS3 games, watching Bloomberg and the occasional movie through the PS3.I would reccomend this TV 110%. It is still worth it at this price definitely, but I would look to see if anyone is selling it for $378 still...

Reviews.Title: best set for the price
Reviews.Author: Steven H. "steven"
Reviews.Content: IT SEEMS EVERYONE HAS THIS SET FOR $550. SO I THOUGHT IT TO BE PRICE FIXED.SO WHEN BRANDS MART LOWERED THE PRICE TO 448. I BOUGHT IT. GREAT COLOR BEST HD. YOU SHOULD NOT HAVE TO SPEND MORE AND 1080P IS A WASTE OF MONEY FOR ANY SET UNDER 50 INCHES.ALL PRICES ARE FALLING NOW.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: R. Englekirk
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about 2 years back and his has exceeded my expectations.  I bought it primarily for use as a display for my MacMini (which works perfectly) but now have it hooked up with cable, an Xbox, AppleTV, and an N64.  After 2 years of daily use, sometimes up to 8 hours a day, the picture is still as great as the day I bought it.  The menu is straightforward and simple to use in conjunction with the remote and the inputs/outputs in the back are ideal for the not-too-serious home theatre setup (similar to mine).  I'd highly recommend this set to anyone looking for a reliable, simple 32" TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: S. Waller "Shandra"
Reviews.Content: We have had this TV for some time. It has a great picture. We love this TV. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome investment
Reviews.Author: shizzyvill
Reviews.Content: wen i got this tv i was blown away at how beautiful it was. I put it together then took two hdmi cords and hooked one up to my xbox and one up to my laptop and bought a wireless keyboard with a built in mouse. and i gotta say my life hasnt been the same. I swear i didnt expect the tv to be this big and with such great quality. its definitely worth the 300 dollars i chipped out on it. I encourage everyone to get this one its perfect.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV
Reviews.Author: B. Nguyen "No love for Retail prices."
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv refurbished and it has worked fantastic for 7 months so far.  We use it in our bedroom and the picture is great.  I have always purchased Samsung tvs and they have always been great buys.

Reviews.Title: Flat Screen TV
Reviews.Author: Bill V.
Reviews.Content: What an outstansing TV.  I purchased this for my brother and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful HDTV
Reviews.Author: PRJ since1990
Reviews.Content: For what I need, this is perfect. Plenty of plugs on the back for everything of yesterday's and today's world. I only use it for my 360 and a movie/tv show via my laptop occasionally, but I sit about 5 ft away and it's plenty big enough.I recommend this one to anyone who wants good quality from Samsung or who needs a smaller TV for their room but wants HD and a decent sized screen.

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Dave Dodd "mtndog"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3d Samsung, and at this point I would buy no other brand.  The picture is crisp and clear, and the sound is as good as my 46" Samsung.  The menu system and remote are superior to even my older Samsung units.Terrific product at a great price - way-to-go Samsung and Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: V. Velez "Kudzu23"
Reviews.Content: I've had this for 3 months now and love it for the price.  I would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonbly priced HD TV (I paid $380, looks like thats not available anymore).  I also have a SONY XBR 46" in 1060 which naturally has a more crisp picture, but this 720 is quite crisp for the price. Easy to setup too.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32B360 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: "Allegan" "Angel Girl"
Reviews.Content: This was not the 32 inch that I wanted but by a convenient event I got it. After setting it up and watching it for a few week now, I am not sorry. The picture quality using standard definition connections is amazing almost HD quality. The color is brilliant,The blacks are black and the whites white. There is no fading from side viewing and the sound is above average. The one draw back here is the number of available standard definition connections the set have. 1 component and 1 composite. There is no S-video. This I find is room for improvement because if you have more than 2 older pieces of audio video equipment then you need to purchase a multimedia scaler or something like that to use them with this TV.That aside the TV is a really great purchase for a small room like a bedroom or small family room. 4 stars and not 5 because It should have had another 1 or 2 standard def connections. If that's not a problem for you, then this is a splendid deal for the money. You will be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: I am very happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: B. Beaulieu
Reviews.Content: I bought this to put in my bedroom. I don't like watching TV in bed, but my wife does.  Since it is a bedroom TV, I didn't want to spend the money for the newest technology, and it is a very good value for what you get.  The picture is very clear, the sound was surprisingly good (I never use built-in speakers before... I love my B&Ws; in the family room), but if I had to do it over again, I'd get a slightly bigger screen.  It's just a tad small for the distance we have it from our bed, which is about 12 feet from our heads to the screen.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: Alan M. Feldman "amf6"
Reviews.Content: For less than $400, this is a terrific TV. Picture is great, remote is easy to use, nothing bad. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Patricia Mason
Reviews.Content: Like this TV a lot. Good picture. Easy to setup.Samsung LN32B360 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: George A. Sifuentes
Reviews.Content: What an improvemnt over the old 27" TV we had. Excellent picture and sound. And very easy to install and set-up

Reviews.Title: Can't beat a Samsung for quality of images
Reviews.Author: ejlcom
Reviews.Content: Having two Samsung LCD monitors (and insisting upon the brand when buying a new, larger one), it was a no-brainer to choose a Samsung LCD television to mount in our motorhome.  What a difference in the quality of picture we got via the old (now gone) analog TV.  We love this Samsung (32-inch) TV and will be purchasing a larger Samsung LCD for our home soon.The lighter weight of the LCD set makes it a joy to handle in our motorhome, where we have to dismount it each time we travel.  The reason: we set the TV lower, over the original spot for the now-gone analog television; the current location impedes the driver's view so the LCD has to be removed...it travels on our bed.Ordering through Amazon.com was a piece of cake.  The TV showed up in three days after ordering!We highly recommend this brand.  The only complaint we have is that the price dropped $20 a week after we received this set. Even for the extra $20 we paid, it was a very good price...and the quality just cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32" Alot of Quality for the Price
Reviews.Author: BaStar
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. It is the second one I bought. I hung the first one over my bar and needed a new one for my bedroom.  I really like the quality of the picture, sound is good and remote control is easy to use.  I'd highly recommend this product for someone wanting a quality TV under $400. The price seemed to vary on this TV, but I did get mine for $399

Reviews.Title: Would Recommend
Reviews.Author: Jonathon Schwamman
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a little over two months now and I'm quite happy with it. I have a samsung monitor that matches this TV and I have always been happy with their products. They have a higher contrast ratio then a lot of other TVs in the price range and overall the picture looks great. I haven't had any problems with viewing angle and sound quality is adequate. The product is aesthetically pleasing but the glossy surface may require a occasional cleaning(included a cloth). The remote isn't anything special but I think it's above average and I like the button placement. My only real problem was how long the TV takes to turn on and change channels. It seems to be a little slower then other LCDs I have seen. This isn't too much of an issue for me though because I have dish so the dish receiver does all the channel changing. For the price though(I paid $380+tax) it's an excellent TV and if this is the size and/or price range you're looking for then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: WOW, did I pick the right TV!
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Hittelman
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st HD Flat-screen purchase in my life, and I had done some research and asked friends that have them. I could have bought a Vizio for under $300 but I decided to go with the brand that got the highest rating for this size TV..Samsung. The set up is soooo easy (and the box is under 30 lbs) and the picture is AMAZING. I only needed 2 HDMI ports (1 or cable box and 1 for the PS3. I would recommend this model to anyone that's looking for a flat-screen. It is in my bedroom and I watch it all the time. Buy with extreme confidence. Not 1 bad thing to say about this!

Reviews.Title: A great investment
Reviews.Author: John Wright
Reviews.Content: I picked this up to replace a smaller tv and have been totally amazed at the quality of the picture on this one.  I had one minor problem hooking it up due to my being technologically challenged but one phone call to the Samsung customer support number took care of that and they were fantastic to deal with.If you are looking for a 32" tv, do yourself a favor and get one of these.  Yes, as others have said, the sound could have a little more bass in it but it is still ok as is.

Reviews.Title: Great smaller HDTV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Vandelinder
Reviews.Content: I got this HDTV for my wife to watch the 2010 Winter Olympics and she isthrilled!  The picture is great and the colors pop- and I haven't even fine tuned it yet.  This size tv was the largest that would fit our Entertainment Unit.  I was considering a Vizio unit of the same size- but Radio Shack had this one on sale for less- we got it for $380.  Great HDTV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: breng2903
Reviews.Content: we recently purchased this TV for our bedroom. I did upgrade our cable box to HD as i didnt like the standard picture quality and all has been great since. PS3 is great on it too. For 379 => great deal

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture.... While It Lasted
Reviews.Author: Lee Engler
Reviews.Content: After happily owning a larger Samsung LCD for a few years, we decided to stick with the brand and purchased this TV for our bedroom.  The picture quality was great.  So was the sound.  Right out of the box, we were very happy.Within two weeks, the TV stopped turning on completely.  The little red light on the front just blinked slowly.  Bliiiiiink, bliiiiiink, bliiiiink.  After trying everything in the manual, and searching the internet only to find out that this seems to be a common problem, I called Samsung for assistance.  A 32 inch TV is 'too small' for their local warranty service provider to service (no drop off option, even in a large metropolitan area), so they finally agreed to pay the shipping costs to send it in for service.  While that was a nice gesture, I'm still out over $40 for packing it (does anyone really save the original packaging for something like this??).While it might be a nice unit when it works, I'll think twice before insisting on a Samsung for our next TV.  If I was willing to pay this kind of money for something that wouldn't work, then I could have purchased from any company out there.3 stars because it was nice while it lasted.  Stuff happens.... but they are penalized because it happened to ME.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a good price
Reviews.Author: Bill "Bill"
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV a week ago for our kitchen and we really love it. Picture is amazing in HD, especially watching the winter Olympics.Pros - Picture and the sound are great for what we are using it for. I'm not sure why others have commented on bad sound, it sounds good to us. The speakers are hidden on the bottom and face downward which is what we wanted since it makes the overall size smaller and cleaner looking. It's in the kitchen and we are not using it for movies. Mostly, just for sports and news. The colors are bright and crisp and the blacks are dark. Setup was simple and the remote and menus are easy to use.Cons - These are not cons for us since they did not change our decision to buy this TV. However I feel I should mention some of them. There are no connections on the side of the TV; all are located in the back. If you wall mount the TV this could be an issue if you wanted to easily connect a camera or other devices. We mounted on the wall, but used an articulating arm; this makes it easy for us to access the rear connections, we just swing out the TV. There are no USB or card slot for viewing pictures and no S-video. We are only using an HDMI cable which was not included. This TV comes with no cables which I found strange. I've since learned that most now don't. When connecting my Sony HD Handycam to this TV using the component connections, the picture is great, but not as good as on my older Sony Plasma. Moving objects did not appear as fluid. Maybe if I was to use the HDMI it would be better, however I don't have that cable for my camera.I'm not sure I'd be happy with this as a primary TV since it's only 32" and I feel the new Plasmas have a truer picture, better in high lit rooms, and truer colors such as flesh tones. I'm sure some would argue this, it's just my option. It would make a great bedroom, or small room TV.We looked at a lot of TV's in the size range and feel at this price (I paid $450) it's a hard TV to beat.

Reviews.Title: A Nice View For You!
Reviews.Author: William A. Ray
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 32" LCD Samsung a few weeks ago, and am I happy that I did. I rate the video as clear study and bright; not as bright as my 55" LCD Samsung, which is a 1080p vs 720p, but this is a super TV for my 16'X20' bedroom. This TV allows one to change the size of the picture in addition to the many other features. The volume is quite adequate, it allows one to set a time to automatically turn off. Its light weight weight and can be mounted on the wall or table...Finally, the price is fair, ranging from about $350 to $400 dollars.I purchased my set from Amazon!William A Ray Sr.Plainfield, NJSamsung LN32B360 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32B360: Day One
Reviews.Author: S. OMAY
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV yesterday and set it up last night.  Set up was a breeze, and the set is definitely light enough for one person to move.  I'm a small lady and had no problem lifting it up above my head onto a shelf.  I was leary about getting 720p, but the picture is perfect.  I won't be using this as a PC monitor or for gaming, so I believe the 720p is perfectly adequate.  So far, on day one, I'm very pleased with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Matthew Bader
Reviews.Content: Excellent Visuals, sound is good, game mode is great for playing with my xbox 360 (virtually no hd lag).

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Julie Kennedy
Reviews.Content: got this 32" Tv for about $450 and love it a great deal on a samsung. exceptional picture and sound quality. just have had over a week now and i ordered the hi def channels on cable and am so impressed by the color contrast.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for the price
Reviews.Author: Sundown AL
Reviews.Content: This TV was to replace a 10 year old bulky Fisher TV.  I ordered it on Feb 12th and it was delivered to my door the next day.  And this was with Free Shipping!!!.I have Cable TV, but have not yet subscribed to any HD channels.  Since my cable company charges extra for HD access, I don't plan to subscribe to HD access.  But I primarily got the HDTV so that I can play bluray disks.  But after hooking up the B360, I was pleasantly surprised to see how clear the picture was.  It is actually better than my old Fisher TV.So if you have to replace an old TV set, and don't have a subscription for HD access, or just need a spare TV for the bedroom or guest room, this is an inexpensive option.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. C. Herrera
Reviews.Content: Purchased this unit for the Bedroom. We have a Samsung 61' LED DLP in the living room for about a year and totally love it. Decided to go ahead with Samsung this time around for the bedroom.This TV has rich colors right out the box. Audio is just ok. My 26' Sharp LCD it's replacing had much richer sound and deeper bass. However, it's not the worse.Only 2 HDMI inputs. Maybe an issue from some. Only Way I can see that being an issue is if you plan on using this as your main tv. For those 2 negatives, I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.For those who are new to HDTVs and are beating yourself over 1080p and 720p: don't do it.For screens under 50 inches (some say 55 inches), the naked eye can not and will not notice and appreciate any difference in picture quality. Also keep in mind, this TV does produce 1080i, which is what all HDTV channels brocast in. 1080P is only viewable on Blu-Ray for the moment. And even if this set was 1080P for your blu-rays, once again - you won't notice the difference. So please don't let that be an issue for you.Overall, great TV for the bedroom or budget tv for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Leigh
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv since December 2009 and it is amazing! I was surprised when I got it because it was so light. The picture quality is very good. I bought it for less than $400 and the price was worth it considering it is a 32-inch lcd.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Sanderson
Reviews.Content: We loved this TV so much that we went out and bought another one for the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Product
Reviews.Author: Jose Li Diaz "Joe"
Reviews.Content: The only thing missing is that there is no option to set it for "PIP" or Picture in Picture, so you can't have a TV Picture with aa auxiliar Picture.But, besides that, the TV is Perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Ron Wis "Rw"
Reviews.Content: I have a Panasonic Viera 32" and the picture on both tvs' is excellent. I am giving the Samsung a slight edge because it is a bit more user friendly. The channel information displayed on the Samsung is more detailed and the buttons on the remote control are better arranged. Some people have complained about the sound quality. I will tell that even on a the top of the line Samsungs, the sound quality does not even approach a dedicated theater system. You can easily add a home theater system for 100-200 dollars. Check Consumer Reports for reviews. The Samsung was very easy to set up. Great product. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: J. Gant "Rob"
Reviews.Content: This TV is a perfect fit for my bedroom. Great connections, picks up my digital cable channels directly from the co-ax (Comcast, North Boston). My one complaint is that the TV needs to be dusted every day. I do have a cat, and that is the problem. Nothing else I have attracts the dust like this TV. The black bezels around the screen really show the dirt, but the screen stays relatively dust free.Make sure you know who you are buying this from. I didn't get it directly from Amazon, so it was slightly more expensive and came via FedEx. If you get it from Amazon it ships via a special carrier, includes scheduled delivery and setup. Next time something tries to ship via FedEx I plan to have it shipped to the closest UPS store to the warehouse and then shipped to me UPS. FedEx blows; tracking is uninformative and outdated, re-routing requests is impossible, and when I went to the depot to pick it up the guy rolled the box too me. Thank god for double boxing and airbags.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph Headapohl
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom and have been pretty happy with the sound and picture quality. I just wanted a good low end TV and the Samsungs looked better than some of the off brand lcds. I have a higher end 46 inch samsung for the living room and it's great quality lead me to get one for my room. The 720p vs 1080p is negilible at this size. It would be nice if it had more inputs but who has a home theatre in their bedroom. I would strongly reccomend Samsung tvs for anyone and their larger high end (series 6 and up) tvs are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Good for a 15 x 15 foot room
Reviews.Author: Ian J. Aman
Reviews.Content: This TV has crisp clear imaging with the HD channels and does not even show a difference in the regular programming. I love it since I am able to connect to my macbook pro and watch movies. No complaints here so far and I have had for a few weeks.  It's perfect for a  15 by 15 room. The only thing that I wish it had was additional inputs on the side like most flat screens for easy accessibility with game systems,etc.

Reviews.Title: samsung 32" TV
Reviews.Author: J. SNOW
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV to replace an older HD ready Samsung for a bedroom TV.  We love the flat screen, light weight and great picture. All of our TVs are Samsung. You can't beat the quality and price.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Diane I. Springer "Orange County Reader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this television at the Black Friday sale and it was well worth the money.  It has a great picture, and good sound quality.

Reviews.Title: LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Patrick
Reviews.Content: Samsung is one of the best LCD HD TV's.  This is the 2nd one I ave purchased in the last three years...clarity, sound and design...excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: aubradford
Reviews.Content: I did lost of research before buying this TV.  I was initially set on a 1080p, but kept reading and being told that until you get about 37 inches, the difference will be minimal if noticeable.  Other models of this size in the same price range that I looked at had a much lower contrast ratio, which was another reason I went with this one.  We use this set as the main TV in our living room and so far we only have our standard DVD player connected to it via component cables and I excited to see the difference when we hopefully attached a blu-ray player soon.  Going from an old CRT set to this was a huge leap for us and we are thoroughly pleased with the picture and performance so far.

Reviews.Title: Good value LCD
Reviews.Author: M. Kade
Reviews.Content: Got this for $399 off Amazon, $150 cheaper than our local Best Buy. Great sound and video quality. Great for sports, movies and regular programming.

Reviews.Title: Good pick for first grown-up TV!
Reviews.Author: S. Bullock "SHB"
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest, I had done all my research and decided on a Sony 1080p/120Hz 37" set.  So, I went to Best Buy and was looking around at everything, from every angle and switching the channels from the demo mode they show in stores to the air channels.  This one was out on the floor as an "Open Item," so I studied it for a long time, looked at every channel, turned up the sound, and everything checked out.  Plus, it was $150 below retail because it was an open item.Since the one I really wanted was twice as much (the low end model, at least) and we're trying to save money overall, I went for this one.  I have watched DVDs, my Nintendo Wii, air channels, DTV network channels, and I am pleased!  I have decided that it depends much more on the source than the TV for good picture.  The HD channels show up better than the air channels.The Best Buy near me has stacks and stacks of them as I write this, so go out andpick one up!

Reviews.Title: Great with a Roku!
Reviews.Author: Melch Savon
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first television in years to use with my Roku HD. That's a box that hooks up to your wireless network and streams Pandora, [...], and Amazon.com Online to your TV. Go buy one, you'll be happy.Now I can't always see HD by eye no matter what anyone says. But I spent hours streaming HD from Amazon.com through the Roku to this television last night, shows I've seen before, and it was AMAZING! After some basic configuration to tell the television that it is getting an HD stream I was in Heaven. The picture is perfect, the blacks black but not so much it takes over half the screen as I have seen in other televisions.What can I say? Good built-in speakers, looks great, incredible price. I say go buy it now! For around $400 it's just hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: Better than what I thought...
Reviews.Author: Mitchell D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this TV at Best Buy on 11/28/09, but I've been browsing and researching TV's on Amazon for a little over a year now.  I picked it up on a whim, I knew that I would buy a Samsung for my first LCD purchase and I couldn't say no to a $377.00 price tag ($405.00 after taxes.)Great picture and very good sound quality.  I've put it through its paces with my PS3.  Running on HDMI initially it did some glitching and a couple disconnects but has been solid since.Only problem I have it volume adjust, to low while watching TV and way to high with the PS3 running.

Reviews.Title: Good TV.
Reviews.Author: Chun Li
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom.  I was debating between this one and Sony KDL32L5000.  A deal at Crutchfield made me buy this one.  Compared to the Sony, this TV has one fewer component input.  But the input options are enough for most scenarios.  I connect a basic cable feed to the RF, a satellite receiver to the composite, a 3-year old DVD player to the component, and a laptop to the VGA, leaving the two HDMI inputs open.  (I am writing this review using the TV as monitor.)  The source cannot be 1080p, which might appear to be a shortcoming compared to the Sony.  But I don't have any 1080p source yet and when I have it in the future, I can always set it to output 1080i or 720p.  The video will be down-sampled to 768p anyway.I give 4 stars because this TV did not meet my expectations, which were based on my 46 inch 1080p Samsung and might be too high for a 720p.  Since the LCD has 768 rows, all 720p and 1080i sources are resampled.  There is no way to display a 720p source natively without pixel resampling.  This may be true for all 720p TVs with 768 rows.  For my 1080p TV, there is a "just scan" option for 1080i sources, which makes the source very crisp.  I thought this TV would have a similar option for 720p sources.  Actually it has a "screen fit" option for 1080i sources, which won't overscan and will display the full frame of the input, downsampled to 768p of course.  This feature probably is copied from Samsung's 1080p firmware but it would be great if 720p sources receive the same treatment.  After all, this is a "720p" TV.  In contrast, the laptop connection is crisp as there is no pixel resampling.These technical issues are barely noticeable when viewing from six feet away.  So for normal use, this TV is great.  The interface and settings are very similar to my other Samsung, which made it easy for me to get used to the new TV.Update 10/19/2009:  The "Screen Fit" option (i.e. no over scan but still resampling to fit 768 rows) is available only for HDMI (720p/1080i), Component (1080i) or DTV (1080i).  This is why I did not see this option for 720p DTV sources.  Even for HDMI input with 720p, you cannot see 1:1 pixel mapping.  Now I know why it is called "screen fit", not "just scan".  I guess I won't buy 720p TV (a.k.a. 768p TV) any more.

Reviews.Title: Great for 2 years
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Chaney "Drew C."
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this TV for 2 years until it went completely dead.  Problem is probably with the power supply but unless you can fix them you are buying a new TV if out of your 1 year warranty.  Total hours on this set was very low as this was in the guest room.  I will not buy any more TV's from Samsung.  Go Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Didn't Last Long
Reviews.Author: Power Plant Electrician
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this television stopped working after only about a year.  I don't watch it that much, it literally had less than 100 hours of use before the power supply failed and it won't turn on any more.  That's pathetic.I know it was cheap, but I figured I was paying less for lesser quality picture and sound.  Apparently I was paying less because of very poor construction.  If they can't make it last longer than this, it's not even worth the $300 it cost.I would've spent more in order to get a longer life out of it.  Unfortunately, it also died just a couple months after the warranty expired, and the cost of repair is almost the cost of a whole new television.Very disappointed.UPDATE:  It is possible to find a new power-supply online.  I purchased one for about $60 and was able to easily repair this television.  However, my low opinion still stands, as this should not have been necessary, and to read about it, apparently this is not an uncommon problem in Samsung flat screens.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Tahani
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV I have ever seenI really like itGood picGood soundGood,  good , goodGoodEtc........Tahani

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: EBLAKE "ELIZABETH"
Reviews.Content: Really love this TV. It arrived before schedule in great shape. Had no problems hooking it up. And have been pleased with the picture quality and color since we have been using it.

Reviews.Title: Major Problem
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: I have owned this product for three years and something burned up inside the unit.  It no longer works and I understand Samsung has has a lot of problems with their sets.  I don't think I would buy another Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Very good 32" 720p HDTV
Reviews.Author: TFB
Reviews.Content: This 32" TV is very good. I thought that the TV was able to get bright enough for that pop in contrast that I like to see. I calibrate all my TVs based on using various calibration Blu-Rays as well as utilizing AVS forum user suggestions. While this may not be as good as a professional calibration, it usually works out well. I had this TV stacked up against the TCL 32", LG 32LK450 and Sony 32EX310. The TCL 32" seemed to provide an acceptable picture but not as detailed as the others, but it was able to provide better contrast than the LG & Sony (I was surprised as well). In the end, I felt that the Samsung was not as soft as the Sony and LG and provided enough contrast and sharpness to edge the others out. One of my favorite 32" TVs of all. It will hold me over well until OLED or some other technology provides enough improvement to make a change, but I don't see that happening for at least another 5 years.

Reviews.Title: Samsung  SALN32B360 32" LCD
Reviews.Author: Abudu56 "rahman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV December 29, 2009 and it died today almost exactly 2 years later. This is the second Samsung product (my Samsung Evergreen phone) I have that has gone bonkers. My wife and my cellphones cuts off whenever it wants to and restarts. Today I give up on Samsung. I will not purchase another Samsung product ever. I have had Sony and Nokia products that I have beat the heck out of, dropped and even dipped in water and they still worked. I will never purchase another Samsung product unless I have to. My Toshiba and ViewSonic LCD monitors and TV's are older and still working great.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Paul Gleason "PauliDawg"
Reviews.Content: At under $400 for a 36" TV I am more than satisfied.  While it is an older technology LCD, it is more than adequate as our bedroom box.  If you want unbelievable picture quality and technology then the eight series is what you must invest in.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for 3 months
Reviews.Author: J. Anthony
Reviews.Content: It was a great tv for 3 Months have to pay to send back to manufacture and package who saves package 3 months? with base very costly to ship. Base does  not really come off after being put on. Look else where for a good set.

Reviews.Title: Two defective units
Reviews.Author: mishka kosolapyi
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV twice and both units were DOA. Amazon was great but avoid the hassle, look for another set.

Reviews.Title: Overall pretty good except on/off timer won't work with HDMI cables
Reviews.Author: Panthera75
Reviews.Content: I do love the TV, it has great picture and sound.  The only thing I truly hate is that I can't utilize the on/off timers because I'm using HDMI cables.  I'd assume most people would use HDMI cables and feel it was a flaw in the making of the tv not being able to use the timers. Other than that, it's a great tv. I love how it swivels too.

Reviews.Title: Spend a little more on another set
Reviews.Author: M. Haney
Reviews.Content: I got this set as a warranty replacement for the LN32A330.Supposedly this is a newer model, it was a step in the WRONG direction! The reason my older set needed to bereplaced was for a defective main board- the audio would cut in and out of HD channels.This does the same thing!! arrgghh.Not only that, but I can hardly get any HD channels now, the tuner actually got worse.The audio is so horrible on this set , that I get a headache after 5 min of watching TV. It's very tiney sounding, even after adjustments.The picture also looks alot worse  w / "jaggies" with high speed pictures. I know this is an inherent problem with LCD, but did not happen as often as this new set.Maybe it's just my luck, but have never owned a samsung product that I would recommend to anybody (Cellphones, DVD players, and now TV)I can't say really anything good about this tv. I should have spend the extra cash and got a Sony.

Reviews.Title: can't compare to LG
Reviews.Author: T. Pham "PhD"
Reviews.Content: EVeryone say Samsung is the best but once i got it... can't even adjust the color right,panel in the back where you plug in the cable is thin and weak, a little press i think I would break the panel.return and got the LG, it is perfect and color is sharp and nice as default setting.

Reviews.Title: TOO EARLY TO TELL...ONLY HAD IT 2 WEEKS...GOOD SO FAR
Reviews.Author: John Wootten
Reviews.Content: I WAS LOOKING FOR A TV ABOVE BAR AREA IN BASEMENT...ONLY HAD 2 WEEKS....DOING GREAT SO FAR...NO COMPLAINTS.....

Reviews.Title: 1 year & 2 months later
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This was the original review for the earlier model of this TV(LN32A330) however I feel it still applies as other Samsung models are known to have the same issues.This LCD was a steal for the kind of picture and sound quality it provided. We rarely had any issues with it until now. One day when we came home we were looking forward to just vegging on the couch to watch our program. Grabbed the remote and pressed the power button. The Direct TV console turned on followed by the familiar red light at the bottom center of the tv. This is usually followed by a distinct ringing beep that would indicate the power is turned on. There was no beep. No ring. No sound. No picture. Just pure black with the red power light winking at us. We tried everything to resurrect the picture including disconnecting the power cord and using different wall sockets. Nothing. I called Samsung worldwide and the service agent said that it is a service call issue however since we bought the TV on June 30 2008, we are no longer covered by the warranty as it is now August 2009. It amuses me how crap like this happens soon after the warranty runs out. I looked all over online and many Samsung owners of various models and sizes have experienced the same thing, a defective power supply and it will have to be replaced. I also looked to see if I could do it myself if I buy the part and save a little scratch. But it turns out that it involves using a soldering gun and having failed shop class, I figured I would call a professional. Repair will cost upwards of $250 including service call, parts and labor. Just when you think you're getting a bargain, just be aware that it could cost you in the long run. Next time I don't think I'll worry about spending a little more if it means not having to go through this headache.

Reviews.Title: Poor Shipping Choice
Reviews.Author: R. Lasar
Reviews.Content: First of all, the TV is fine, no problems. I had to cancel my order from Amazon after they shipped it to me via a company called Pilot Air Freight. This company sat on the TV for 10 days wondering how they were going to get it to me since they do not service my area. They finally consigned it to another freight company who only services my area once a month. So here I sit waiting over a month for my order; not in today's world, I cancelled my order and bought the same TV at Wal Mart for less money. I phoned Amazon and they will not refund my money until the TV gets back to them from Pilot Air Freight, that I never received in the first place. What a joke to say the least, I guess I will have to file a dispute with my credit card company. Like I said the TV I bought at Wal Mart is great it is Amazon and Pilot you have to watch for.
